column4: honda ilian: yes but if you have a SATA hdd apparently ubuntu installcd's don't recognize partitions
bickrud: my exact problem as well
apparently the way to solve the unrecognized partition problem is to run the latest livecd and fix everything with gparted
personally i just left about 80gigs unformatted in my windows install and imo use that with gparted, dont even need to touch my windows
of course anybody running a livecd will probably have my problem and be stuck for almost 30minutes at "enterprise volume management system"
My live CD took  only 5 minutes to book.
something is wrong man... wut is ur hardware conf?
did you tried the advanced boot feature?
there must be an option to boot with SATA.
very strange... How many GB is this SATA?
how did you partitioned the linux partition? did you flagged it?
when you boot with the installation cd... the whole hdd seems to be unformatted right? Isn't it showing only the 50GBs and ignoring the NTFS partition?
so, when you run the partition aplication, it shows 200GB of non partitioned hdd?
strange... It should at least shows 130GB of non recognized type or something like that lol
trying to figure it out also...
I know, but what program is on the ubuntu cd for patitioning?
could not figure out a solution, pass me your e-mail and I'll try to find something about it...
